intro: Eupatorium crispiflorum, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It produces small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its scientific name reflects its distinctive crinkled leaves and showy floral display.
